conclusion: The electric field between the plates of a parallel-plate capacitor is uniform and can be calculated using the formula E = V/d.
The potential difference V can be calculated using the formula V = Q/C.
The electric field E can be expressed as E = Q/(Cd).
The force experienced by a point charge q in an electric field E is given by the formula F = qE.
Substituting the expression for E, we get F = q(Q/(Cd)).
The magnitude of the electrostatic force experienced by the point charge q is (qQ)/(Cd).
